definitions.definition: A member of the clade Simiiformes other than those in the clade Hominoidea containing apes , generally (but not universally ) distinguished by small size , tails , and cheek pouches .
examples: He had been visiting an area zoo when a monkey swung from its tree perch, swiped his glasses and hurled them into a hippo hole.

definitions.definition: Any simian primate other than hominids , any monkey or ape .
examples: Chimpanzees are known to form bands to hunt and kill other monkeys .

definitions.definition: A human considered to resemble monkeys in some way , including :

subdefinitions.definition: A naughty or mischievous person , especially a child .
examples: Stop misbehaving, you cheeky little monkey !

subdefinitions.definition: The person in the motorcycle sidecar in sidecar racing .
Synonym of idiot : a person of minimal intelligence .
Synonym of uggo : an unattractive person , especially one whose face supposedly resembles a monkey's.
Synonym of puppet : a person dancing to another's tune , a person controlled or directed by another .
examples: No, no, no, not you. I want to talk to the organ grinder , not the monkey .

subdefinitions.definition: A menial employee who does a repetitive job supposedly requiring minimal intelligence .

subdefinitions.label_groups: slang , highly derogatory , ethnic slur , offensive

definitions.definition: A small trading vessel of the sixteenth century.
The vessel in which a mess receives its full allowance of grog .
The weight of a pile driver or drop hammer .
A fluid consisting of hydrochloric acid and zinc , used in the process of soldering .
Synonym of five hundred , especially ( British ) 500 pounds sterling or ( US , dated ) 500 dollars .
A person's temper , said to be "up" when they are angry .
A drug habit ; an addiction ; a compulsion .
examples: Everybody's got something to hide except for me and my monkey .

definitions.definition: A dance popularized by Major Lance in 1963, now usually only its upper-body dance move involving exaggerated drumming motions .

main_definition: ( strictly ) A member of the clade Simiiformes other than those in the clade Hominoidea containing apes , generally (but not universally ) distinguished by small size , tails , and cheek pouches .
secondary_definitions: ( loosely , sometimes proscribed ) Any simian primate other than hominids , any monkey or ape .
( figurative , generally derogatory ) A human considered to resemble monkeys in some way , including :
( historical ) A small trading vessel of the sixteenth century.
( slang , nautical ) The vessel in which a mess receives its full allowance of grog .
The weight of a pile driver or drop hammer .
A fluid consisting of hydrochloric acid and zinc , used in the process of soldering .
( slang ) Synonym of five hundred , especially ( British ) 500 pounds sterling or ( US , dated ) 500 dollars .
( slang ) A person's temper , said to be "up" when they are angry .
( slang ) A drug habit ; an addiction ; a compulsion .
( dance ) A dance popularized by Major Lance in 1963, now usually only its upper-body dance move involving exaggerated drumming motions .
